synopsis: This episode begins with a flashback revealing Misaki’s childhood relationship with her father. The setting takes place in 2315, during the time Misaki begins her military training at boot camp.
Misaki, along with her new team, begins a field-training mission. The mission becomes surreal when a friend from Misaki’s time period arrives on the field.
Lyar traverses back in time to Feudal Era Japan in search of a ghoul. She is accompanied by a man who assists in her mission.
Meanwhile in Feudal Era Japan, Lyra encounters another spectral. This spectral is apparently Misaki….but in her ghoul form?!

Within the shadows, a bloody coup attempt is taking place in pre-World War II Japan. Kiri and Kotoko have been dispatched to quell the ghoul presence. Upon their arrival, Kiri learns the cause of all the strange ghoul events.
Misaki travels to a time period, in which her father is still alive. Her father is in preparation to go to Watcher’s Nest.
Watcher’s nest meets another version of itself on another timeline. Suzanne and company travel to the second Watcher’s nest to investigate.

Misaki is in the quantum core, trying to hold back the Ghouls, and contacts the others. Suzanna realizes that she has has artificial memories placed inside her mind. Kiri hooks up to the integral system, in order to guide Lyar to Misaki.
The gateway has been opened and the Ghoul will be able to travel through not just the inflation hole at Watcher's Nest, but through all the inflation holes in the universe.
Misaki makes contact with her father's ghost.
LeBlanc enters the same ruins as Misaki and takes over the Integral System.
Misaki, Lyar, and Kiri return to the ruins to combat the giant Ghoul, which is under control by LeBlanc. Misaki asks why LeBlanc wants to use the Ghoul powers to destroy the universe.
Misaki comes to Lyar in a dream and tells her that she wanted to change the past to avoid all the sadness and despair caused by humanity's interaction with Watcher's Nest.
